name: Hema C. P. Movva
text: Very affordable personal size build your own pizza. They have the standard pizza toppings and sauces. Good spot for no-risk lunch and dinner. Would've been useful if they had a few recommended topping-sauce-crust combinations for patrons to try.

name: Natasha Mason
text: The pizza is fantastic and the staff were informative and helpful. I love the customization feature of this restaurant. I wish they had a garlic ranch sauce, though.

name: Jade Marie Kokinda-Rodriquez
text: Love love love the pizza!! Very quick and yummy. This is our #1 go to when we go visit our son in Portland.  I highly recommend trying it if you haven't already.

name: Jennifer Pasquill
text: Really loved this place for a quick meal! It's a local chain where they make everything right in front of you. You customize your pizza from start to finish, telling an actual person behind the counter what you want and dont want on your ‚Ä¶More

name: Eric Adams
text: It is similar to mod pizza and tastes just as good but slightly different. They do seem to upcharge on more items though. I had to pay extra for the cheddar. It tasted good so it was worth it.

name: Phil Carriere
text: Takes about 10 minutes to make and about $10 (flat rate, not dependent on toppings). Pre-selected toppings or build your own, including type of crust ( they even had cauliflower and gluten free!), Sauce (I had delicious pesto), variety of ‚Ä¶More

name: Sidharth Ragavendran
text: Awesome awesome awesome! I loved the thick crust Pizza! The staffs are very friendly and this is a good pizza shop in downtown. You can get all the pizza (both custom & menu) below $10.

name: Mark Rippstein
text: Good, clean price for a thin, personalized, fire-baked pizza. Friendly service. The crispy outside and fresh toppings make up for the rather bland dough. Great place for a meal on your own, with friends or with family.

text: Personal pizzas anyway you like it. Lots of choices. Gluten-free. Thick or thin. Cauliflower even. Meats were flavorful and the veggies were fresh. This location is convenient to Pioneer Square and central downtown.

name: Brittny James
text: So yummy. Can easily split the small size between 2. I love the variety and that you get to make your own pizza! Well kinda. You tell them what to put on it and they cook it. Like subway for pizza.

name: lisa torry
text: Walked into Pieology by accident on way to Pioneer Square. What a lucky find!!! Ordered thin crust with vegetables - it was delicious!  Mitch made our fabulous pizza and was so friendly and kind. We will be back!

name: Vaughn Swearingen
text: Incredibly delicious pizza with a fantastic stuffed crust. Only complaint was that our server was not very helpful with our order. Didn't feel like I knew what all my options were

name: Igore Killgod

text: Not another pizza joint, right? Well, good build-your-own pizza, friendly staff, good value for price. From what I've experienced, I wouldn't change a thing.

name: Clint Quisenberry
text: A good make-your-own pizza place, similar to Mod pizza, for those familiar with that chain.  Unlike Mod there were no pizza suggestions that you could modify...you just made your own unique pizza.  The staff was nice and the atmosphere was fine, nothing particularly good nor bad.  I would return if I was back in the area.

name: Judith Saperstone
text: i just had a bad experience with this place. It took 40 minutes before they handed me a pizza that was half burned. I asked for my money back. They did not use my debit card so I am not sure it worked but I did get a receipt just in case. ‚Ä¶More

text: Subway for pizza is how I describe it. Never been here when it's busy, but always had good service. Good selection of everything: crusts, toppings, sauces, beers & wine. And super quick!

name: Joe Lamana
text: Pizza was good and the service was fast.  However, there is only one size pizza-personal pies.  Not a problem as it was just enough. Would recommend it for sure.

name: anthony ho
text: Decent, freshly-made to order pizza marred by extremely slow service.  During my visit, it took 30 minutes to actually get my food, from walking in the door to getting a box in my hand.  There were six people in line ahead of me, hardly a ‚Ä¶More

text: I love this place!! The pizza is AMAZING and the staff is so helpful and nice. It's family/child friendly place and I suggest trying it out! You won't be disappointed with all the toppings and great favors!!

name: Juli Moffit
text: Staff so friendly and accommodating! Took 8 teens there for a birthday lunch and they weren't frustrated at all.

name: Animals and Technology A Positive Live Stream
text: This is an awesome place to get a custom made delicious pizza. Actual time from making to oven is not a long wait. Lines can be long at meal times and seating is ment for groups. Bathrooms available for customer and awesome employees. Eat healthy or comfort style they have a lot of choices.

name: Ashley White
text: Very similar to MOD pizza, but way better. The ingredients are better and it tastes better. You can get a personal pizza around $8 with unlimited toppings. I was very pleased.

name: Casey Jean Hostetler
text: Our first time at Pieology was not a disappointment. The staff were very friendly and the service was fast. Clean inside and out, just a very fun place overall. Good food! We got full quickly.

name: Stephen Weber
text: Build your own personal pizza with unlimited toppings for a very reasonable price. The MAX and Streetcar are within walking distance. If it's a nice day out, order to go and eat outside at Director Park right next door.
